column4: Fsck died with an exit error of 1 right before it finished my /home partition. what does that mean???
must i wait for 30 boots to do a fsck, can i initiate it?
there is a flag on shutdown that forces a check at the next boot
you can also boot the live cd and check it that way.
if you like, you can set the number 30 to 10, or 5, or 1
depends on the error.
the flag on shutdown i -F.       shutdown -F now
you set/change the number with tune2fs
the fsck error?  it doesn't say anything other than error 1?
it says fsck died due to an error of exit 1
it has to say something before that.  well, it doesn't _have_ to, but I've never seen it only say exit 1.
fsck itself crashed, then
try booting the live cd and running fsck from there.
sounds like you might have a mismatch.  that's why I tell everyone not to do that (and get roundly abused for saying so ...)
can i fix it?
of course your problem may not have anything to do with that,
what is a mismatch
say a configuration file intended for use with one version of a program but being used by another.
cant i just go on my ./home parition and delete all the files with a . before them?
sure, you can.  I would rename the, not delete them
mkdir dot-files
